newsitem.title: USA: Cyrk in merger pact to buy Simon Marketing.
newsitem.headline: Cyrk in merger pact to buy Simon Marketing.

text.p: Cyrk Inc, a provider of promotional products and services, said it agreed to merge with privately-held Simon Marketing Inc, a Los Angeles based global promotion agency.
Terms of the deal were not disclosed.

Cyrk said it expects the deal to be accretive to 1997 earnings and, combined with recent acquisitions, provide for a 1996 pro forma revenue base of about $700 million. It did not disclose what the impact would be on profits or margins.

Founded in 1976, Simon Marketing provides marketing programs, promotional products and packaging to clients including McDonald's Corp, Viacom Inc's Blockbuster Entertainment business and Chevron Corp.

It has produced premiums and promotions including McDonald's Happy Meals and Monopoly, according to a release by Cyrk. Simon Marketing has about 450 employees in 10 offices in the United States, Canada, Europe and Asia.
